definition: to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Any third-party vendor so used has agreed to protect the confidentiality of information provided by VCES.
sentences.chinese: 任何第三方卖主习以为常答应保密资料器件。

sentences.english: Housewives were picking out vegetables and bargaining with the sellers.
sentences.chinese: 家庭主妇们一边挑选蔬菜，一边和卖主讨价还加。

sentences.english: My computer is second-hand and the seller didn't give me anything else.
sentences.chinese: 我买的是二手电脑，卖主没给我别的东西。

sentences.english: Joe rowed the seller about the price.
sentences.chinese: 乔为价格和卖主吵了起来。

sentences.english: Many home sellers remain stuck in a recessional rut.
sentences.chinese: 许多房屋的卖主仍然陷在经济衰退的困境中。

sentences.english: Seller shall not be entitled to compensation for cancelled non-custom Goods.
sentences.chinese: 卖主不会有资格获得对被取消的非风俗物品的报偿。

sentences.english: The  cell seller  seldom sees the bell belt  melt.
sentences.chinese: 小单间的卖主很少见到铃铛带子融化。

sentences.english: Seller can only post one sales thread only.
sentences.chinese: 卖主只能开一个佛牌买卖帖。

sentences.english: The cell seller seldom sees the bell belt melt.
sentences.chinese: 小单间的卖主很罕见到铃铛带子融化。

sentences.english: Seller will withdraw offer unless accept by tomorrow noon.
sentences.chinese: 除非明日午前接受，否则卖主将撤消报价。

sentences.english: But some financial services software vendors are already moving in this direction.
sentences.chinese: 但是一些金融服务软件卖主已经在朝这个方向努力了。

sentences.english: On the bus the busy businessman did a business with the buyer.
sentences.chinese: 在公同汽车上，繁忙的商人与卖主做了一笔生意。

sentences.english: Asked the seller, in fact, they are ill-understood.
sentences.chinese: 问卖主，其实，他们也是一知半解的。

sentences.english: Wu agreed to contact a vendor recommended by Mr. Zhang.
sentences.chinese: 吴先生同意联系张先生推荐的卖主。

definition: to make a counteroffer when haggling/to bargain
to bargain/to haggle with a peddler
asking price/to ask a price/to demand terms (in negotiations)
to beat down the price/to haggle/to slash one's prices
to ask a price/to charge/asking price
